SalesAIScoreModelFactor.name: SalesAIScoreModelFactor
SalesAIScoreModelFactor.description: Represents the factors that Sales Cloud Einstein uses to build a scoring model. Scoring models are used by features, such as Opportunity Scoring, to score individual records.

Factor.description: A factor that contributes to a scoring model. For example, a factor could indicate that an amount increase has a positive effect on an opportunity score (AmountIncreasePositive). Or, it could indicate that a change to the close date has a negative effect on an opportunity score (CloseDateChangeNegative).

FactorSummaryOrgLanguage.description: Describes the factor in English. For example, the factor field value AmountChangePositive is summarized as “Amount change has positive effect”.

Name.description: The ID of the model factor. Currently, the name is a system-generated value.

OperatorType.description: The operator used to analyze field values. For example, the factor HighSuccessLeadSource uses the Lead Source field as the primary source field. When building the scoring model, Einstein uses the Equals operator to determine PrimarySourceFieldValue = Internet. The other supported operator is IsNull.

PrimarySourceFieldName.description: The name of the primary field used in the model factor. For example, the factor HighSuccessIndustry uses the account’s Industry as the primary field.

PrimarySourceFieldValue.description: Information used to retrieve the PrimarySourceFieldValueText, such as a record ID or value.

PrimarySourceFieldValueText.description: The value of the primary source field used in the model factor. For example, the factor HighSuccessIndustry uses the account’s Industry as the primary field, and the value of the Industry field is manufacturing.

SalesAiScoreCycleId.description: The ID of the score cycle used to generate model factors. Each score cycle can have multiple model factors associated to it.

ScoreCorrelation.description: The strength between a model factor and a score. If score correlation value is closer to +1, it’s more likely that the model factor contributing toward a high score. If score correlation value is closer to -1, it’s more likely that the model factor is contributing toward a low score.

SecondarySourceFieldName.description: The name of the secondary field used in the model factor. For example, the factor HighAmountActivity uses Task as the primary field and Event as the secondary field. Not all model factors use a secondary source field.

SecondarySourceFieldValue.description: Information used to retrieve the SecondarySourceFieldValueText, such as a record ID or value. Not all model factors use a secondary source field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

SecondarySourceFieldValueText.description: When the model factor is based on two source fields, this field represents the value of the secondary source field. For example, the factor HighSuccessMultipleSameFieldValue might use the opportunity’s related product as the primary field and pricebook as the secondary field. The product and pricebook names are indicated by the PrimarySourceFieldValueText and SecondarySourceFieldValueText, respectively. Not all model factors use a secondary source field. This field is available in API version 50.0 and later.

Status.description: Determines whether the model factor is active or inactive.

SalesAIScoreModelFactor.accessRules: a Sales Cloud Einstein license with the “View Scoring Model Factors” permission enabled
